abstracts.cdata!:
This results profile talks about the
            social assistance in West Bank and Gaza. The mechanisms and
            programs were needed to reduce malnutrition and to protect
            the health and well-being of the Palestinian population,
            which was confronted with high levels of poverty,
            unemployment, and population growth. The Social Safety Net
            Reform Project has supported the Palestinian authority in
            developing and managing one of the most advanced cash
            assistance programs in the region. Social Safety Net Reform
            Project has provided cash transfers to more than 63,000 poor
            families using an effective poverty-targeting mechanism and database.
